title: Why Doctors Think They’re The Best
summary:
Key ideas:
- 90% of doctors think they are above-average doctors.
- Doctors may fall into traps, including overestimating their skills, selection bias, and not noticing when patients switch to other doctors.
- Every doctor may make errors at the same rate but about different things.
- Doctors satisfy their own values and trade-offs.

Key learnings:
- Selection bias is dangerous as patients who love their doctor will stick with them longer.
- Doctors underestimate and lack self-awareness of their shortcomings.
- Doctors can't notice their own errors, which may lead to misdiagnosis.

Key questions:
- Do other professions outside the medical field face a similar tendency to fall into these traps?
- Would it be helpful for doctors to have their patients submit feedback to improve their self-awareness of their shortcomings?
